intro: Primula vulgaris subsp. balearica, commonly known as the Balearic primrose, is a flowering plant native to the Balearic Islands. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm. The plant features upright, hairy stems and produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens.
